column4: hey all trying to install ubuntu from windows here and i have unetbootin on my grub list but am unsure how to create an ext2/3 partition from windows
unetbootin setup grub on my windows bootloader
and it goes to instlal but cant find an ext partition to use
so wondered how i could make from within win32?
that's a prob there is no cd drive or usb boot from bios!
you can get floppy images to boot usb devices on pendrivelinux
you could take out the drive, put it in another PC, install  to it then transfer the install back to the original system
change refresh rate may help
where do i do that?
what video card do you have?
not sure its old, ill check
run: lspci | grep -i vga
lspci says SiS 630/730
under prefs there is the display config, you can set display stuff there
how do i get to prefs?
on the gnome bar. System -> preferences
oh sorry there's no gnome or xorg etc just a console machine
i see, not sure then
had ot install ssh blind to be able to connect and see the full text in shell
getting fluxbox from apt now
fluxbox is cool, lxde is also pretty sweet
not heared of that - i'll check it out!
